intro: Pancratium leavenworthii, commonly known as the yellow rain lily, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in wetlands and marshy areas, thriving in moist, sandy soils. It has strap-like leaves and produces a bulbous underground stem that stores nutrients. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardeners in suitable climates.
